Name: Tacet Discord Hunter
Description: Find the Resonator who once proclaimed to be "Tacet Discord Hunter" to obtain the precious TD Material.
QuestDesc: Find the Resonator who once proclaimed to be "Tacet Discord Hunter" to obtain the precious TD Material.

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm begging you. Miss Koko, you must have some way to save my daughter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But...

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it about the payment? I'll give you all my savings if that's what it takes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not about the money!

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, you're here. But sorry, the shop's closed for now.

Options.PlotLineKey: Miss Koko, do you need any help?

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. I'm okay. This lady here isn't a threat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her daughter's dealing with a rare illness—non-life-threatening for now, but it could get worse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Doctors have tried everything, but regular medicine isn't working. There's one last hope, though.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, my teacher handled a similar case before, and I still have the prescription from back then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The issue is, the crucial "guide drug" is tough to get.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The "guide drug" is the most critical ingredient in the prescription. Currently, only some wealthy folks have the "guide drug" we need, and they probably won't sell it for money unless...

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unless you can find some rare items to exchange with them. Oh, by the way, Rover, have you ever heard of something called "Bell Spiriton"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we had that "Bell Spiriton," we could use it to exchange for the "guide drug."

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not something easy to obtain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss Koko, do you know how to get it? I'll do anything!

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can only find "Bell Spiriton" from a Calamity-Class Tacet Discord called Bell-Borne Geochelone. Have you heard of it?

Options.PlotLineKey: Fought one, but didn't find any "Bell Spiriton."

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even Rover hasn't heard of it. Not that surprising, though. Only a handful of people have the chance to see it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's said to have a body as huge as a mountain, can crush an armored car with only one step, and freeze a river with a single breath!

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Many tried to hunt it down in the past, but they all became revenants frozen in the river.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, it doesn't usually leave its territory, so it's even rarer for people to see it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People with sanity won't willingly pick fights with it, let alone risk their lives for an herb.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, you get how formidable it is. Nobody dares to challenge it, not to mention putting their lives on the line for an herb.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seriously? You took it down? You're not pulling my leg, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even so, you didn't get the "Bell Spiriton." That's a pity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How can this be? Is there really no way?

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm…

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, there's someone I know who might still have some "Bell Spiritons," but the problem is, he's a bit unreliable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not sure, but he did sell me plenty of rare TD materials before. It seems like he's got a few tricks up his sleeve.

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please tell me how I can find him. No matter how slim the hope is, I'll give it a try.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks! So, let this lady stick around to help me prepare other herbs, and I'll leave the task of obtaining "Bell Spiriton" to {PlayerName}? Sound good?

Options.PlotLineKey: No problem. Leave it to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His name's Lianfeng, and he hangs around the theater all the time. You should spot him there.

Options.PlotLineKey: How will I know who he is?

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He goes by "TD Hunter" and talks a big game about hunting formidable TDs, although no one has actually seen him fight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you see someone being loud and boastful over tea at the theater, that's Lianfeng.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you see someone being loud and boastful over tea at the theater, that's Lianfeng.

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, please help me. I've got no other options.

Dialogues.Speaker: Guan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Lianfeng, you have a guest here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who are you? I don't know you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you looking for me? Who told you I'm here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Darn. Did she send you to collect debts?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing, forget it. Anyway, why are you looking for me? Spill it. I don't have time to waste.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fengxi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on! You're just having tea here with us. Oh! Nice tea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just so you know, if you're here to borrow money, then you can turn around and leave. I'm broke. Flat broke.

Dialogues.Speaker: Guan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can sell those PRECIOUS materials you've obtained from TDs, huh? They should earn you a great sum.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I sold them all a long time ago.

Options.PlotLineKey: All of them? What about the material called "Bell Spiriton?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't have any. Speaking of which, I once obtained some from a TD called Bell-Borne Geochelone. Well, forget about it. After all, you won't have a chance to see it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why am I telling you all this? You're just wasting my time. Get outta here; don't spoil my moment drinking this delicious tea.

Options.PlotLineKey: Where else can I find it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not lying, but I'm the only one that can obtain "Bell Spiriton".

Dialogues.Speaker: Fengxi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then why not go take down that Bell-Borne thing again?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seriously? I'm not going! I'm tired of dealing with minions like Bell-Borne Geochelone. Whoever wants to go can go by themselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fengxi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're that strong, why did you quit the Pioneer Association? Or, were you kicked out?

Dialogues.Speaker: Guan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard from Miss Maqi that you quit. So it's true, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nonsense. I quit because I don't need any companions or assistance to take down TDs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm a lone wolf. I don't waste time getting along with people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Guan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, friend, I remember you're Rover who just came to Jinzhou, right? Why do you want this thing?

Options.PlotLineKey: (You explain the situation about that mother and her sick daughter)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's unfortunate, but so what? Why should I help someone I barely know? Go find someone else.

Dialogues.Speaker: Guan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, how can you be so cruel? Have some compassion!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fengxi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my, I really can't stand stories like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the matter with you two?

Options.PlotLineKey: Mr. Lianfeng, please lend us a hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, but…
Hahaha! Please explain this matter in detail to us Pioneer Association!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry for the abrupt intrusion! We didn't intend to eavesdrop your conversation. It's just your voices were a bit loud.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tsk, are all members of the Pioneer Association this rude?

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In fact, we're the Explorers of the Pioneer Association, and I'm the captain of this squad. Are you Rover? Nice to meet you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Guan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, Lianfeng, you're ignored!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shut up. Hey, what do you want?

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, we're heading to the Gorges of Spirits to investigate a giant Tacet Discord found there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Our goal is to take Bell-Borne Geochelone down for further research.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we happened to hear your conversation and thought if we could help the unfortunate mother and daughter at the same time, it'd be great.

Dialogues.Speaker: Guan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's great! Please help them!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fengxi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're such good guys, unlike Lianfeng.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you insane?

Options.PlotLineKey: Can you really defeat that giant Tacet Discord?

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. We've thoroughly investigated Bell-Borne Geochelone, and our squad is composed of experienced Resonators.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we've never heard of this "Bell Spiriton" before. It seems like an interesting research subject. I'm sure the Editorial Department will be thrilled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, Rover, just wait for our good news! Bye!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, that's too dangerous! You're all going to die! Hey, stop!

Dialogues.Speaker: Guan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just let them do their work, Lianfeng. You're being ridiculous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me? Ridiculous? I just don't want to see them throw away their lives so rashly!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not a member of the Pioneer Association anymore. They can do whatever they want. I don't care.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But they're underestimating that TD. Members of the Pioneer Association are too focused on research and investigation. Sometimes, they forget they're dealing with extremely formidable creatures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fengxi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you're a man of strength, why not join in and help out? We'll respect you as a true man.

Options.PlotLineKey: Mr. Lianfeng, let's go help them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tsk, easy for you to say.

Dialogues.Speaker: Guan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, he's backing down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you underestimating me? Fine, I'll go! But I won't help them fight Bell-Borne Geochelone. I already said I'm done with the Pioneer Association!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll tell {Male=him;Female=her} how to take down Bell-Borne Geochelone as {Male=his;Female=her} "Master"!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like you're skilled enough. With my guidance, you'll be more capable than those guys in the future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fengxi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, as long as you're happy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. Hope you'll be as composed facing that formidable TD.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tsk. Anyway, with an experienced "TD hunter" by your side, nothing could go wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One more time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that case, you'll know I wasn't bragging. Wait and see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, come! Let's have a private talk over there. Don't let these fools hear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fengxi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As if we'd love to hear. We've had our fill of tea. Bye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Guan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Boss, put it on Lianfeng's tab!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Out, out, out! Get out! Don't waste our time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aren't you afraid to fight against TDs?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I mean, Bell-Borne Geochelone is a very dangerous opponent. You might get hurt or even lose your life fighting it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though that mother and daughter are quite pitiful, you don't have an obligation to help them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if you back out now, no one can blame you, including that mother and daughter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Keep this conversation between us. I'll try to figure out a way to get the "Bell Spiriton" for you, so you don't have to risk your life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though we've only known each other for a short time, I don't want to see you die on my watch.

Options.PlotLineKey: You're experienced, so I'm safe with you around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've got some guts. Well, not bad.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph. Are you doubting that I've never hunted that TD?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's straightforward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine, even though you said that, I can tell from your expression that you're not fully convinced.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can't blame you. Honestly, I sometimes doubt if I'm a true "TD Hunter" myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you heard of the Overclocking of a Resonator?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're quite knowledgeable. Have you ever encountered a Resonator after Overclocking?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seriously? You've never heard of it? Given the fact you're a Resonator, that's a surprise. Overclocking is a negative phenomenon that occurs in Resonators. Different Resonators have different symptoms.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If left unchecked, it can lead to severe aftereffects, even completely altering a Resonator's personality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For example, I'm one of the unlucky Resonators who went through it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've experienced Overclocking before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps, I don't really remember because the researchers at the Academy confirmed that I lost most of my memories after Overclocking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some memories, like how to fight those TDs, stay with me—no matter how hard I've tried to forget them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though in those memories, I always hunted them alone. There's always this strange feeling of unnaturalness... Forget it. You won't understand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, not the right time to talk about this now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go. I'll head to the meeting point outside Jinzhou and wait for you there. I already sent the coordinates to your Terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're ready, meet me there. Don't dawdle. We need to catch up with them!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cough…

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm fine. Just a bit careless to be attacked by those minions. Not a big deal. I scared them off effortlessly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's with that look! Seems like it's time for your first lesson as my apprentice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rule Number One for "TD Hunter"—"Never look down upon minions!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even weaker enemies can cause unexpected trouble. Got it?

Options.PlotLineKey: But you didn't seem to follow your own rule.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem, I intentionally put myself in danger to teach you a lesson.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, it's your loss not listening to me. I'm speaking from experience.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good, remember my words. They'll be useful to you one day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bell-Borne Geochelone lives in the Gorges of Spirits, which is the source of the Qing River flowing through here. I can sense the state of a TD through the remaining frequency in the medium.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I told you that only I can find the "Bell Spiriton," right? It's because Bell-Borne Geochelone emits a special frequency during specific periods, and only when defeating it during these periods can one get the "Bell Spiriton."

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No matter how many times you defeat Bell-Borne Geochelone, as long as it's not the right timing, you can't get the "Bell Spiriton," and only my Resonance Ability can tell if it's the right timing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're pretty lucky. There's a high chance we'll get the "Bell Spiriton" if we hunt Bell-Borne Geochelone now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Plus, it seems that those from the Pioneer Association are planning to go to the Gorges of Spirits along the river.

Options.PlotLineKey: I can see signs of someone camping here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like they're well-prepared. The Pioneer Association is really interested in Bell-Borne Geochelone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You wanna know? Curiosity is a good trait! The more you know about your enemy before a battle, the more confident you'll be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's start from the question "how Tacet Discords are formed." Most people believe that they are born out of chaos, but there are some exceptions—some TDs seem to come from legends or even real history.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Legend has it that the ancient army in Huanglong used to sound a bronze bell in battle, inspiring soldiers to fight bravely and symbolizing the good wish of a triumphant return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, the bell ringer saved a turtle along the Qing River by accident. From then on, that turtle became an indispensable part of the soldiers, sharing their happiness and sorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before the fierce battle ended, the bell ringer died. However, the sound of the bell still echoed on the battlefield. It's said that the turtle was the one who sounded the bell.

Options.PlotLineKey: The turtle carried on the duty of that bell ringer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, that's the story. Later, someone found a rusted ancient bell in the Gorges of Spirits, similar in style to the bronze bell the ancient army used.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Underneath that ancient bell was a giant turtle-shaped Tacet Discord. It witnessed the fierce war and bid farewell to the bell ringer and soldiers. These memories tied the heavy ancient bell to its back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it's just a story. After all, no one knows if TDs have memories and emotions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No matter what happened in the past, this TD is now a hideous creature bringing nothing other than pain and torture to Huanglong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't need to show any mercy. If it really had emotions, it wouldn't want to be a creature destroying happiness and peace of people in Huanglong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rule Number Two for "TD Hunter"—"Never show mercy to Tacet Discords!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Pioneer Association should have left not long ago. Let's follow their traces and catch up quickly!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you used the Scan function on the Terminal?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wonderful. Let's follow the path displayed on the Terminal and track them down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is where having me as your master comes in handy. I can teach you everything you wanna know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Turn on your Terminal and select the Scan function. You'll see a path displayed on the screen, and all you need to do is to follow it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understand? Great, let's follow the path displayed on the Terminal and track them down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These are the TDs that just attacked me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Be careful. They seem to get extremely aggressive due to the awakening of Bell-Borne Geochelone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even someone as experienced as me got caught up in a tough battle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That sound…

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a signal that Bell-Borne Geochelone is waking up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh… My head…

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing, just a bit of a headache.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Darn, it's happening again. It feels like something in my memories is about to be awakened.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The problem is, the traces left by the Pioneer Association members seem to disappear here…

Options.PlotLineKey: We can follow the sound of the bell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right, they must be where the bell sound is. Let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey! Wake up! Can you hear me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, you are… those people at the teahouse?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Enough talking. I'll check your injuries with my Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No major organ damage, but there are multiple fractures. Did you fight against Bell-Borne Geochelone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, it can't be called a fight. We're completely crushed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should leave. Though it's calm now, no one knows when it'll wake up again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not an opponent you ordinary people can deal with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ordinary people? You've got us wrong. I'm Lianfeng, a professional "TD Hunter," and this is my top apprentice.

Options.PlotLineKey: "Top apprentice"… You've only got one apprentice, okay?
Just leave it to me and my master!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You guys stay here and rest. Leave the rest to us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, listen carefully to what I'm about to say.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you see the large bell in the center of the "Bell-Borne Ravine"? Ringing it will awaken Bell-Borne Geochelone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since it's giant, it moves and turns slowly, so we'd better…

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Staying away from it will only force us into corners with its massive body. It can also use icy breath and condense water into ice crystals for indiscriminate attacks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though it may seem crazy, it's actually safer to get as close to it as possible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, getting close allows us to take advantage of its blind spots during its turns and attacks. Smart move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Its four legs, head, and tail are all highly offensive weapons. Don't underestimate them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also, its weakness is the big bell on its back, but it's relatively high and not easy to attack under normal circumstances.

Options.PlotLineKey: Unless we can find a way to make it fall…

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have a clear head, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bell-Borne Geochelone's feet are covered in hard ice, protecting them from hard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, it's also its weakness. Once the ice is shattered, Bell-Borne Geochelone will lose balance and fall down, which gives us a good chance to attack its most vulnerable point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll draw its attention, and you seize the chance to attack.

Options.PlotLineKey: Won't that put you in danger?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tsk, are you underestimating a "TD Hunter"? Once you figure out its attack pattern, dodging is easy. That's how we took it down before.

Options.PlotLineKey: We? I thought you defeated it on your own?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We... I... Ugh, my head...

Options.PlotLineKey: Was there anyone else who fought Bell-Borne Geochelone with you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (In my memory, there's a group of people fighting alongside me.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Who were they?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh… my head hurts!

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't push yourself too hard. You'd better take a rest in your condition.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's dangerous to confront Bell-Borne Geochelone on your own.

Options.PlotLineKey: It'll be fine. Leave it all to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, {PlayerName}!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You really took down that monster all by yourself! That's astonishing!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's my apprentice! It should be a piece of cake for {Male=him;Female=her} to deal with such a small fish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't know about them, but I'm perfectly fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What are you worried about? It's just a small hiccup. Anyway, let me see the material you got from Bell-Borne Geochelone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, that's it—the "Bell Spiriton." It's actually the seed produced by the plant on Bell-Borne Geochelone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Squad Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha? Really? Good to know! I need to note it down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my, can't you forget about your stupid research for one second?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Never mind. Forget about them. You need to hurry back to Jinzhou and give this to Koko. I'll contact the Pioneer Association to get them medical treatment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, you're back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is everything okay? Did you find Lianfeng?

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did he still have "Bell Spiriton"?

Options.PlotLineKey: It's a long story. Here, take it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Bell Spiriton"? Oh, yes, this is it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So my daughter can be saved?

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, with this, your daughter can be cured.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it looks so fresh. I thought Lianfeng got it a long time ago.
Because it's freshly picked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uncle Lianfeng?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, show me some respect. It's Brother Lianfeng.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just a little aftereffect of Overclocking. See, I'm totally fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Overclocking? But your symptoms don't seem like it. The aftereffect of Overclocking is supposed to be associated with a Resonator's Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So what? My Forte is frequency perception.

Options.PlotLineKey: But your symptom is memory loss.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm…

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is there a possibility that you didn't really go through Overclocking, and some other incident caused your memory loss?

Options.PlotLineKey: I believe you had teammates fighting with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No way. I've never had any companions or teammates. My dear apprentice, you worry too much. I handle my affairs, and you handle yours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did you get injured?

Options.PlotLineKey: He insisted on being my master.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll share with you the exciting battle between Rover and Bell-Borne Geochelone later. For now, let's make the medicine this lady's daughter needs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Mr. Lianfeng.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No big deal. Taking down enemies of this level is just a walk in the park for a "TD Hunter".

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uncle Lianfeng, what do you think about continuing hunting those giant TDs? If you happen to get any rare materials, I'm still willing to buy them at a good price!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Call me "Brother"! Anyway, I've already retired. I'll leave the title of "TD Hunter" to my chief apprentice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? That's good news. Rover's much more reliable than Uncle Lianfeng.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry! I'll keep teaching you, hahaha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, fine, but not being a TD Hunter is surely a waste of your skills.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great. Now you're the new "TD Hunter," and I'm sure you can do it well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Koko
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right, and of course, you'll earn a fair wage for your work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Perhaps, I can find out the true reason for my memory loss in battles against TDs.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lianfeng
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well then, my dear apprentice, if there's information about new large TDs, I'll contact you!
